frontend_framework.description: NextJS has out of box support for Typescript, TailwindCSS an ESLint. So you can follow installation instructions of NextJS to turn those addons on.

text: Moderate: Next.js is known for its great developer experience, and many developers find it relatively easy to get started, especially if they are already familiar with React.

The framework comes with built-in features like file-based routing, static generation (SSG), and server-side rendering (SSR) that abstract away much of the complexity. So, a beginner who knows JavaScript and React can quickly build simple static or dynamic websites.

High: As you dive deeper into Next.js, the complexity increases. Advanced topics like API routes, serverless functions, image optimization, incremental static regeneration (ISR), and custom server configurations require a higher understanding of web development and server-side concepts.
To fully optimize and scale a Next.js app, familiarity with topics like custom webpack configurations, deployment strategies, and state management is beneficial.
Moderate to High: For a developer already familiar with React, the learning curve is moderate, as Next.js builds on top of React with enhancements for SSR and SSG.
If you're new to concepts like server-side rendering, static site generation, and API routes, it will take a bit more time to understand and apply these concepts effectively.

Moderate: Next.js works well with other tools and libraries, such as GraphQL, Prisma, Redux, TypeScript, etc. While integration with many of these tools is relatively straightforward, advanced features like custom server-side setups or middleware may require additional learning and experience.
Moderate: PostgreSQL is user-friendly for developers familiar with SQL and relational databases.
It provides a robust set of features, but new users may need time to learn advanced concepts like indexing, schemas, and performance tuning.
High: PostgreSQL offers advanced features like JSON support, full-text search, and powerful indexing capabilities.
It also supports complex queries and transactions, making it suitable for enterprise-grade applications.
Moderate to High: Developers with experience in databases can quickly adapt to PostgreSQL, but understanding advanced optimization techniques and configurations takes time.
High: PostgreSQL integrates seamlessly with various programming languages, ORMs, and frameworks like Node.js, Python (Django, Flask), and Java (Spring Boot).
Its versatility makes it a preferred choice for full-stack and microservices architectures.
